org.gearvrf

Class GVRCursorController

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRCursorController

  • public abstract class GVRCursorController
extends java.lang.Object
    Define a class of type GVRCursorController to register a new cursor controller with the GVRInputManager. You can request for all the GVRCursorControllers in the system by querying the GVRInputManager.getCursorControllers() call. Alternatively all notifications for GVRCursorControllers attached or detached from the framework can be obtained by registering a CursorControllerListener with the GVRInputManager. Make use of the setSceneObject(GVRSceneObject) to add a Cursor for the controller in 3D space. The GVRInputManager will manipulate the GVRSceneObject based on the input coming in to the GVRCursorController. Use the GVRInputManager.addCursorController(GVRCursorController) call to add an external GVRCursorController to the framework.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  GVRCursorController.ControllerEventListener
      Register a GVRCursorController.ControllerEventListener to receive a callback whenever the GVRCursorController has been updated.

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        public int getId()
        Return an id that represent this GVRCursorController
        Returns:
        an integer id that identifies this controller.

      • setActive

        protected void setActive(boolean active)
        Use this method to set the active state of the GVRCursorController.
        Parameters:
        active - This flag is usually attached to a button press, it is up to the developer to map the designated button to the active flag. Eg. A Gamepad could attach KeyEvent#KEYCODE_BUTTON_A to active. Setting active to true would result in a SensorEvent with SensorEvent.isActive() as true the affected that GVRSceneObject.

      • setSceneObject

        public void setSceneObject(GVRSceneObject object)
        Set a GVRSceneObject to be controlled by the GVRCursorController.
        Parameters:
        object - the GVRSceneObject

      • resetSceneObject

        public void resetSceneObject()
        This method clears the currently set GVRSceneObject if there is one.

      • getSceneObject

        public GVRSceneObject getSceneObject()
        Return the currently set GVRSceneObject.
        Returns:
        the currently set GVRSceneObject if there is one, else return null

      • invalidate

        public void invalidate()
        The method will force a process cycle that may result in an ISensorEvents being generated if there is a significant event that affects a GVRBaseSensor. In most cases when a new position or key event is received, the GVRCursorController internally invalidates its own data. However there may be situations where the controller data remains the same while the scene graph is changed. This invalidate() call can help force the GVRCursorController to run a new process loop on its existing information against the changed scene graph to generate possible ISensorEvents for GVRBaseSensors.

      • getControllerType

        public GVRControllerType getControllerType()
        Return the GVRControllerType associated with the GVRCursorController. In most cases, this method should return GVRControllerType.EXTERNAL. GVRControllerType.EXTERNAL allows the input device to define its own input behavior. If the device wishes to implement GVRControllerType.MOUSE or GVRControllerType.GAMEPAD make sure that the behavior is consistent with that defined in GVRMouseDeviceManager and GVRGamepadDeviceManager.
        Returns:
        the GVRControllerType for the GVRCursorController .

      • setKeyEvent

        protected void setKeyEvent(KeyEvent keyEvent)
        Set a key event. Note that this call can be used in lieu of setActive(boolean). The GVRCursorController processes a ACTION_DOWN as active true and ACTION_UP as active false. In addition the key event passed is used as a reference for applications that wish to use the contents from the class. setActive(boolean) can still be used for applications that do not want to expose key events.
        Parameters:
        keyEvent -

      • getKeyEvents

        public java.util.List<KeyEvent> getKeyEvents()
        Get the all the key events processed by the GVRCursorController if there are any. This call returns all the motion events reports since the last callback was made. Note that not all GVRCursorController report KeyEvents), this function could also return an empty list for GVRCursorControllers that do not generate KeyEvents. To get every KeyEvent reported by the GVRCursorController use the GVRCursorController.ControllerEventListener or the ISensorEvents listener to query for the KeyEvent whenever a a callback is made. The KeyEvent would be valid for the lifetime of that callback and would be reset to null on completion.
        Returns:
        the list of KeyEvents processed by the GVRCursorController.

      • getKeyEvent

        public KeyEvent getKeyEvent()
        Get the latest key event processed by the GVRCursorController if there is one (not all GVRCursorController report KeyEvent s). Note that this value will be null if the latest event processed by the GVRCursorController did not contain a KeyEvent. Note that this function also returns a null. To get every KeyEvent reported by the GVRCursorController use the GVRCursorController.ControllerEventListener or the ISensorEvents listener to query for the KeyEvent whenever a a callback is made. The KeyEvent would be valid for the lifetime of that callback and would be reset to null on completion.
        Returns:
        the KeyEvent or null if there isn't one.

      • setMotionEvent

        protected void setMotionEvent(MotionEvent motionEvent)
        Set the latest motion event processed by the GVRCursorController. Make sure not to recycle the passed MotionEvent. The GVRCursorController will recycle the MotionEvent after completion.
        Parameters:
        motionEvent - the MotionEvent processed by the GVRCursorController.

      • getMotionEvents

        public java.util.List<MotionEvent> getMotionEvents()
        Get the all the MotionEvent processed by the GVRCursorController if there are any. This call returns all the motion events reports since the last callback was made. Note that not all GVRCursorControllers report MotionEvent s), this function also returns an empty list. To get every MotionEvent reported by the GVRCursorController use the GVRCursorController.ControllerEventListener or the ISensorEvents listener to query for the MotionEvents whenever a a callback is made. The MotionEvents reported would be valid for the lifetime of that callback and would be recycled and reset on completion. Make use to the MotionEvent#obtain(MotionEvent) to clone a copy of the MotionEvent.
        Returns:
        a list of MotionEvents processed by the GVRCursorController .

      • getMotionEvent

        public MotionEvent getMotionEvent()
        Get the latest MotionEvent processed by the GVRCursorController if there is one (not all GVRCursorControllers report MotionEvents) Note that this function also returns a null. To get every MotionEvent reported by the GVRCursorController use the GVRCursorController.ControllerEventListener or the ISensorEvents listener to query for the MotionEvent whenever a a callback is made. The MotionEvent would be valid for the lifetime of that callback and would be recycled and reset to null on completion. Make use to the MotionEvent#obtain(MotionEvent) to clone a copy of the MotionEvent.
        Returns:
        the latest MotionEvent processed by the GVRCursorController or null.

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(float x,
                        float y,
                        float z)
        This call sets the position of the GVRCursorController. Use this call to also set an initial position for the Cursor when a new GVRCursorController is returned by the CursorControllerListener.
        Parameters:
        x - the x value of the position.
        y - the y value of the position.
        z - the z value of the position.

      • removeControllerEventListener

        public void removeControllerEventListener(GVRCursorController.ControllerEventListener listener)
        Remove the previously added GVRCursorController.ControllerEventListener.
        Parameters:
        listener - GVRCursorController.ControllerEventListener that was previously added .

      • setEnable

        public void setEnable(boolean enable)
        Use this method to enable or disable the GVRCursorController. By default the GVRCursorController is enabled. If disabled, the controller would not report new positions for the cursor and would not generate SensorEvents to GVRBaseSensors.
        Parameters:
        enable - true to enable the GVRCursorController, false to disable.

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Check if the GVRCursorController is enabled or disabled. By default the GVRCursorController is enabled.
        Returns:
        true if the GVRCursorController is enabled, false otherwise.

      • setNearDepth

        public void setNearDepth(float nearDepth)
        Set the near depth value for the controller. This is the closest the GVRCursorController can get in relation to the GVRCamera. By default this value is set to zero.
        Parameters:
        nearDepth -

      • setFarDepth

        public void setFarDepth(float farDepth)
        Set the far depth value for the controller. This is the farthest the GVRCursorController can get in relation to the GVRCamera. By default this value is set to negative Float.MAX_VALUE.
        Parameters:
        farDepth -

      • getNearDepth

        public float getNearDepth()
        Get the near depth value for the controller.
        Returns:
        value representing the near depth. By default the value returned is zero.

      • getFarDepth

        public float getFarDepth()
        Get the far depth value for the controller.
        Returns:
        value representing the far depth. By default the value returned is negative Float.MAX_VALUE.

      • setScene

        protected void setScene(GVRScene scene)

      • isEventHandledBySensorManager

        public boolean isEventHandledBySensorManager()
        Returns whether events generated as a result of the latest change in the GVRCursorController state, i.e. change in Position, or change in Active/Enable state were handled by the SensorManager. This can be used by an application to know whether there were any SensorEvents generated as a result of any change in the GVRCursorController.
        Returns:
        true if event was handled by SensorManager, false if otherwise.
